As of our conversation, the Boston Bruins are having a strong season and are currently sitting in a good position in the standings.

In the Eastern Conference, the Bruins are competing in the Atlantic Division, which is one of the toughest divisions in the NHL. Despite the stiff competition, the Bruins have been consistent and have managed to stay near the top of the division.

As for their current standing, the Bruins are likely to be in a playoff spot, but the NHL season is long, and teams can move up or down the standings quickly. However, based on their performance so far, they have a good chance of making the playoffs.

In terms of their chances of making the playoffs, the Bruins have a strong team with a good balance of offense, defense, and goaltending. They have a deep roster with a mix of veteran players and young talent, which has helped them to be competitive in most games.

That being said, the NHL playoffs are notoriously unpredictable, and anything can happen once the postseason begins. The Bruins will need to stay healthy, continue to play consistent hockey, and make adjustments as needed to make a deep run in the playoffs.

To give you a better idea, I can suggest checking out the current NHL standings and the Bruins' schedule for the remainder of the season. You can also keep an eye on their performance in the coming games and adjust your expectations accordingly.

Remember, the NHL season is long, and a lot can happen between now and the playoffs. But as of now, the Bruins are in a good position to make a strong push for the postseason.
